list.name: Default
list.comment: Simple color grid class - uses sprites and a batch for better performance. Reasonable with 100x100 grid.

option.name: myStatusName
option.value: Will be merged with property conflicts

task.summary: Debugging event loop polling. Simple event handling for MapChunk.
Better Viewport scrolling, handle key repeats better in MapChunk event handler.
Does pyglet+cocos2d make more sense as graphics engine than tcod? Let's find out how easy it is to program...
Adapting cocos2d scrolling layer example to use with MapChunk. So far just have the example running as originally programmed. Next step will be to visualize an elevation map.
Simple color grid class - uses sprites and a batch for better performance. Reasonable with 100x100 grid.

And so begins the laborious task of recreating tcod's Heightmap support in python using numpy arrays (and removing dependency on tcod in general). Because, that's why.
I do need the practice, so I feel a bit justified in reinventing the wheel. Also a pure python implementation will facilitate working in 64bit (tcod is 32bit only).
